title: UNLIMEAT: "It’s the Perfect Time to Enhance the ‘Deliciousness’ of Alternative Meat" - vegconomist - the vegan business magazine
summary: UNLIMEAT is a South Korean company producing plant-based products using upcycled materials. They aim to reduce food waste through their products. The company offers a diverse range of plant-based foods and has been expanding in the US market.
green_innovation: TRUE. UNLIMEAT's focus on producing plant-based products using upcycled materials aligns with environmental sustainability goals and aims to reduce negative environmental externalities associated with food production and waste.
business_innovation: TRUE. UNLIMEAT's introduction of plant-based meat products utilizing upcycled materials demonstrates a new and improved business process that differs significantly from conventional meat production processes.
green_product: TRUE. UNLIMEAT's plant-based products made from upcycled materials significantly reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycle by promoting sustainability, reducing waste, and avoiding harmful substances.
green_process: TRUE. UNLIMEAT's approach of utilizing upcycled materials to produce plant-based foods aligns with the definition of a green process by minimizing environmental impacts, reducing waste, and promoting sustainability in food production.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311999 - All Other Miscellaneous Food Manufacturing, 325414 - Biological Product (except Diagnostic) Manufacturing, 311119 - Other Animal Food Manufacturing, 311612 - Meat Processed from Carcasses
greenwashing: FALSE. The article describes UNLIMEAT's genuine efforts in producing sustainable plant-based products using upcycled materials, highlighting their commitment to reducing food waste and environmental impact.

title: Fresh Thyme Market Reveals Inaugural Top Ten Food Trends for 2024 - PR Newswire
summary: Fresh Thyme Market releases trends report focusing on Midwest shopping behaviors and brands. The grocer aims to provide real quality fresh food, vitamins, and body care products aligned with consumer food trends while ensuring trust in hand-selected items.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 445110 - Supermarkets and Other Grocery (except Convenience) Stores, 445230 - Fruit and Vegetable Markets, 445120 - Convenience Stores, 445299 - All Other Specialty Food Stores

title: The plastipelago - New Mandala
summary: The article discusses Indonesia's waste crisis and the government's adoption of the circular economy model to address waste management, emphasizing waste as an opportunity rather than a problem.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses the adoption of a circular economy model by the Indonesian government to address waste management and consider waste as an opportunity for economic growth, aligning with green innovation principles.
business_innovation: FALSE. While the article addresses waste management initiatives and the circular economy, it focuses more on environmental sustainability and waste reduction rather than explicit business innovation.
green_product: TRUE. The article discusses waste management practices that emphasize recycling, waste reduction, and sustainable materials, aligning with the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE. The article touches on waste minimization, circular economy principles, sustainable technologies, and recycling efforts, all of which contribute to green processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities; 562111 - Solid Waste Collection; 562112 - Hazardous Waste Collection; 562119 - Other Waste Collection
greenwashing: FALSE. The article presents a comprehensive discussion on waste management initiatives and the circular economy model without aiming to mislead or make false statements about environmental benefits.

title: The Employer-Educator Partnership That Can Fill U.S. Jobs - HBR.org Daily
summary: The article promotes online leadership training with a focus on attracting and cultivating talent for career acceleration.

title: Brushes with purpose: Kohl Kreatives eyes growth potential among India's eco-conscious beauty consumers - CosmeticsDesign-Asia.com
summary: Kohl Kreatives partnered with Kult App to enter the India market with sustainable makeup products aimed at inclusive design and sustainability. The brand emphasizes the use of upcycled materials and bespoke production methods to create eco-friendly and niche products for a global consumer base.
green_innovation: FALSE This article does not focus on an innovation aimed at reducing negative environmental externalities of human activity.
business_innovation: TRUE The partnership and introduction of sustainable makeup products into a new market represent a new business process that differs significantly from the firm's previous offerings.
green_product: TRUE The makeup brushes and stencil stickers from Kohl Kreatives are designed and manufactured with sustainable materials, reducing environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE Kohl Kreatives employs green processes in its manufacturing and production methods, focusing on reducing waste and promoting sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325620 Toiletry Product Manufacturing, 325620 Toilet Preparation Manufacturing, 325620 Polish and Other Sanitation Good Manufacturing, 325620 Polish and Other Sanitation Goods Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE This article does not exhibit greenwashing as the focus is on genuine sustainability efforts and eco-friendly products.
